Quick Reference Guide Essential commands, patterns, and workflows for the DIP SMC PSO framework.Â¶

Command Quick Reference ### Basic Simulation ```bashÂ¶

Minimal simulation (default controller, no plots)Â¶

python simulate.py # Classical SMC with plots python simulate.py â€“ctrl classical_smc â€“plot # Super-Twisting SMC with plots python simulate.py â€“ctrl sta_smc â€“plot # Adaptive SMC python simulate.py â€“ctrl adaptive_smc â€“plot # Hybrid Adaptive STA-SMC python simulate.py â€“ctrl hybrid_adaptive_sta_smc â€“plot ### PSO Optimizationbash

Optimize classical SMC gainsÂ¶

python simulate.py â€“ctrl classical_smc â€“run-pso â€“save optimized_gains.json # Optimize with specific seed (reproducibility) python simulate.py â€“ctrl classical_smc â€“run-pso â€“seed 42 â€“save gains.json # Quick optimization (fewer iterations) python simulate.py â€“ctrl classical_smc â€“run-pso \ â€“override â€œpso.iters=50â€ \ â€“override â€œpso.n_particles=15â€ \ â€“save quick_gains.json # Thorough optimization python simulate.py â€“ctrl classical_smc â€“run-pso \ â€“override â€œpso.iters=200â€ \ â€“override â€œpso.n_particles=50â€ \ â€“save thorough_gains.json ### Loading Optimized Gainsbash

Use optimized gainsÂ¶

python simulate.py â€“load optimized_gains.json â€“plot # Load and override parameters python simulate.py â€“load optimized_gains.json \ â€“override â€œmax_force=150.0â€ \ â€“plot ### Configuration Overridesbash

Override single parameterÂ¶

python simulate.py â€“ctrl classical_smc \ â€“override â€œmax_force=120.0â€ \ â€“plot # Override multiple parameters python simulate.py â€“ctrl classical_smc \ â€“override â€œgains=[12,9,18,14,60,6]â€ \ â€“override â€œmax_force=120.0â€ \ â€“override â€œboundary_layer=0.05â€ \ â€“plot # Override initial conditions python simulate.py â€“ctrl classical_smc \ â€“override â€œsimulation.initial_conditions=[0,0,0.2,0,0.3,0]â€ \ â€“plot # Override simulation duration and timestep python simulate.py â€“ctrl classical_smc \ â€“override â€œsimulation.duration=10.0â€ \ â€“override â€œsimulation.dt=0.005â€ \ â€“plot ### Saving and Loadingbash

Save simulation resultsÂ¶

python simulate.py â€“ctrl classical_smc â€“plot â€“save results.json # Load results for analysis python -c â€œimport json; data = json.load(open(â€˜results.jsonâ€™)); print(data[â€˜metricsâ€™])â€ # Save configuration python simulate.py â€“print-config > my_config.txt # Use custom configuration file python simulate.py â€“config custom_config.yaml â€“ctrl classical_smc â€“plot ### Hardware-in-the-Loop (HIL)bash

Run HIL simulation (automatic server + client)Â¶

python simulate.py â€“run-hil â€“plot # HIL with custom config python simulate.py â€“config hil_config.yaml â€“run-hil â€“plot ### Web Interfacebash

Launch Streamlit dashboardÂ¶

streamlit run streamlit_app.py # Custom port streamlit run streamlit_app.py â€“server.port 8080 # Network accessible streamlit run streamlit_app.py â€“server.address 0.0.0.0 ### Testingbash

Run all testsÂ¶

python run_tests.py # Run specific test file python -m pytest tests/test_controllers/test_classical_smc.py -v # Run with coverage python -m pytest tests/ â€“cov=src â€“cov-report=html # Run benchmarks only python -m pytest tests/test_benchmarks/ â€“benchmark-only

## Configuration Snippets ### Gain Tuning ```yaml

# config.yaml - Classical SMC

controllers: classical_smc: gains: [10.0, 8.0, 15.0, 12.0, 50.0, 5.0] # [k1, k2, Î»1, Î»2, K, Îµ] max_force: 100.0 boundary_layer: 0.01
``` ### PSO Configuration ```yaml
# Quick PSO (prototyping)
pso: n_particles: 15 iters: 50 # Standard PSO (production)
pso: n_particles: 30 iters: 100 # Thorough PSO (research)
pso: n_particles: 50 iters: 200
``` ### Cost Function Weights ```yaml
# Emphasize tracking accuracy

pso: cost_function: weights: ise: 0.6 itae: 0.2 control_effort: 0.1 overshoot: 0.1 # Emphasize energy efficiency
pso: cost_function: weights: ise: 0.2 itae: 0.2 control_effort: 0.5 overshoot: 0.1

Python API Patterns ### Basic Simulation ```pythonÂ¶

from src.controllers.factory import create_controller from src.core.simulation_runner import SimulationRunner from src.config import load_config # Load configuration config = load_config(â€˜config.yamlâ€™) # Create controller controller = create_controller( â€˜classical_smcâ€™, config=config.controllers.classical_smc ) # Run simulation runner = SimulationRunner(config) result = runner.run(controller) # Access results print(fâ€ISE: {result[â€˜metricsâ€™][â€˜iseâ€™]:.4f}â€) print(fâ€Settling Time: {result[â€˜metricsâ€™][â€˜settling_timeâ€™]:.2f}sâ€) ### PSO Optimizationpython

from src.optimizer.pso_optimizer import PSOTuner from src.controllers import create_smc_for_pso, get_gain_bounds_for_pso, SMCType # Get bounds bounds = get_gain_bounds_for_pso(SMCType.CLASSICAL) # Create PSO tuner tuner = PSOTuner( controller_type=SMCType.CLASSICAL, bounds=bounds, n_particles=30, iters=100 ) # Optimize best_gains, best_cost = tuner.optimize() print(fâ€Optimized gains: {best_gains}â€) print(fâ€Final cost: {best_cost:.4f}â€) ### Batch Processingpython import numpy as np # Define initial conditions initial_conditions = [ [0, 0, 0.1, 0, 0.15, 0], [0, 0, 0.2, 0, 0.25, 0], [0, 0, 0.3, 0, 0.35, 0], ] results = [] for ic in initial_conditions: config.simulation.initial_conditions = ic result = runner.run(controller) results.append(result[â€˜metricsâ€™][â€˜iseâ€™]) print(fâ€Mean ISE: {np.mean(results):.4f}â€) print(fâ€Std ISE: {np.std(results):.4f}â€)


---

## Performance Metrics Reference ### Primary Metrics | Metric | Formula | Interpretation | Lower is Better |

|--------|---------|----------------|-----------------|
| **ISE** | âˆ«â€–xâ€–Â² dt | Tracking accuracy (quadratic) | âœ“ |
| **ITAE** | âˆ«tÂ·â€–xâ€– dt | Time-weighted error (convergence) | âœ“ |
| **Settling Time** | t when â€–xâ€– < 5% | Convergence speed | âœ“ |
| **Overshoot** | max(â€–xâ€–) / setpoint | Peak deviation | âœ“ |
| **Control Effort** | âˆ«â€–uâ€– dt | Energy consumption | âœ“ | ### Controller-Specific Metrics | Controller | Special Metrics |
|------------|-----------------|
| Classical SMC | Chattering index (du/dt variance) |
| Adaptive SMC | Adaptation trajectory, final gain |
| STA-SMC | Finite-time convergence, continuity |
| Hybrid | Adaptation + continuity |

---

## Troubleshooting Quick Fixes ### Problem: Simulation diverges ```bash

# Reduce timestep

python simulate.py --ctrl classical_smc --override "simulation.dt=0.005" --plot # Reduce initial perturbation
python simulate.py --ctrl classical_smc \ --override "simulation.initial_conditions=[0,0,0.05,0,0.08,0]" \ --plot
``` ### Problem: PSO not converging ```bash
# Increase swarm size
python simulate.py --ctrl classical_smc --run-pso \ --override "pso.n_particles=50" \ --save gains.json # Widen bounds (edit config.yaml)
pso: bounds: - [0.1, 100.0] # Wider k1 range # ... etc
``` ### Problem: Simulation too slow ```bash
# Use simplified dynamics

python simulate.py --ctrl classical_smc \ --override "simulation.use_full_dynamics=false" \ --plot # Reduce duration
python simulate.py --ctrl classical_smc \ --override "simulation.duration=3.0" \ --plot
``` ### Problem: Import errors ```bash
# Verify working directory (must be project root)
cd /path/to/dip-smc-pso # Re-run simulation
python simulate.py --ctrl classical_smc --plot

File Locations Reference ```Â¶

project_root/ â”œâ”€â”€ simulate.py # Main CLI â”œâ”€â”€ streamlit_app.py # Web UI â”œâ”€â”€ config.yaml # Main configuration â”œâ”€â”€ requirements.txt # Dependencies â”‚ â”œâ”€â”€ src/ # Source code â”‚ â”œâ”€â”€ controllers/ # Controller implementations â”‚ â”‚ â”œâ”€â”€ factory/ # Factory system â”‚ â”‚ â”œâ”€â”€ smc/ # 4 core SMC controllers â”‚ â”‚ â”œâ”€â”€ specialized/ # Specialized controllers â”‚ â”‚ â””â”€â”€ mpc/ # MPC (experimental) â”‚ â”œâ”€â”€ core/ # Simulation engine â”‚ â”œâ”€â”€ optimizer/ # PSO implementation â”‚ â””â”€â”€ utils/ # Utilities â”‚ â”œâ”€â”€ tests/ # Test suite â”‚ â”œâ”€â”€ test_controllers/ # Controller tests â”‚ â”œâ”€â”€ test_core/ # Simulation tests â”‚ â””â”€â”€ test_optimizer/ # PSO tests â”‚ â”œâ”€â”€ docs/ # Documentation â”‚ â””â”€â”€ guides/ # This directory â”‚ â””â”€â”€ scripts/ # Utility scripts â””â”€â”€ validate_documentation.py

## Common Workflows ### Workflow 1: Baseline â†’ Optimize â†’ Validate ```bash
# 1. Baseline
python simulate.py --ctrl classical_smc --plot --save baseline.json # 2. Optimize
python simulate.py --ctrl classical_smc --run-pso --save optimized.json # 3. Validate
python simulate.py --load optimized.json --plot --save validated.json # 4. Compare
python -c "
import json
b = json.load(open('baseline.json'))
v = json.load(open('validated.json'))
print(f'Improvement: {(1 - v[\"metrics\"][\"ise\"] / b[\"metrics\"][\"ise\"])*100:.1f}%')
"
``` ### Workflow 2: Controller Comparison ```bash
# Run all 4 controllers

for ctrl in classical_smc sta_smc adaptive_smc hybrid_adaptive_sta_smc; do python simulate.py --ctrl $ctrl --plot --save results_${ctrl}.json
done # Compare
python -c "
import json
for ctrl in ['classical_smc', 'sta_smc', 'adaptive_smc', 'hybrid_adaptive_sta_smc']: data = json.load(open(f'results_{ctrl}.json')) print(f'{ctrl:25s} ISE: {data[\"metrics\"][\"ise\"]:.4f}')
"
``` ### Workflow 3: Monte Carlo Robustness Study ```bash
# Create batch script
cat > batch_study.sh << 'EOF'
for mass in 0.7 0.8 0.9 1.0 1.1 1.2 1.3; do for trial in {1..10}; do python simulate.py --ctrl classical_smc \ --override "dip_params.m0=${mass}" \ --seed $((mass * 100 + trial)) \ --save "results_m${mass}_t${trial}.json" done
done
EOF chmod +x batch_study.sh
./batch_study.sh
